â
'''Oscar Grant Plaza''' is an unofficial name for the Frank H. Ogawa Plaza in Oakland, California. In 2011, the plaza became the site for the main encampment of the [[Occupy Oakland]] movement, which renamed the plaza in memory of [[Oscar Grant]], who was shot and killed by Oakland police in 2009.
+
'''Oscar Grant Plaza''' is a historic location in the heart of downtown Oakland, California. The plaza is also known as "City Hall Plaza" or "Frank H. Ogawa Plaza". In 2011, the plaza became the site for the main encampment of the [[Occupy Oakland]] movement, which renamed the plaza in memory of [[Oscar Grant]], who was shot and killed by Oakland police in 2009.
==Location==
==Location==
Oscar Grant Plaza is bounded by 14th street on the south. The west side of the plaza is the site of [[Oakland City Hall]] and Oakland Police Headquarters.
Oscar Grant Plaza is bounded by 14th street on the south. The west side of the plaza is the site of [[Oakland City Hall]] and Oakland Police Headquarters.

** In
** In November, 2011, it was reported that Google Maps had been updated to reflect the change to Oscar Grant Plaza. <ref>KQED - [http://blogs.kqed.org/newsfix/2011/11/02/image-google-maps-shows-frank-ogawa-plaza-as-oscar-grant-plaza/ Google Maps Shows Frank Ogawa Plaza as Oscar Grant Plaza] - Nov 02, 2011.</ref>
